iso_math.definition: Isomorphic patterns in mathematics across scales capture structural equivalences in abstract hierarchies—mappings where structures, operations, and transformations preserve relations invariantly. These include categorical functors, homological sequences, and graph isomorphisms, validated via category theory (e.g., IMPG tasks per web:0/1; Δ-Motif subgraph iso at scale per web:2/3) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., algebraic resolutions to neural generalizations per web:4/5). Hard-to-vary invariants like structural preservation enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm isomorphism/deny difference/both in mappings/neither in universals); scores >0.98 based on 2025 mathematical abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from category theory/web and mathematical overlays (e.g., graph iso to AI embeddings).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., cosmic math links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., homological iso); integrate diachronic depth (set theory foundations to 2025 LLM generations).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: if graphs match, then relations preserve)

properties.principle: string (hard-to-vary invariant, e.g., Structural preservation toward ...(truncated 5576 characters)... context: 2025 Cross-Domain, structure: Focus on generative age, universality: Cross-domain: Mapping invariants)

data.description: Meaning dynamics in pre-meta; traces map invariantly (e.g., self-similar patterns per web:7).

tetralemmas: Affirm mapping/deny variance/both in generations/neither in abstractions.
